intro: Astragalus hegingensis, commonly known as the Heping milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest for its potential medicinal properties. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and over-collection.
